title.value: Deploying Deep Reinforcement Learning Systems: A Taxonomy of Challenges
title.justification: The title of the paper is clearly stated.
title.quote: Deploying Deep Reinforcement Learning Systems: A Taxonomy of Challenges

extractions.description: This paper presents an empirical study on Stack Overflow to uncover and understand the challenges practitioners faced when deploying Deep Reinforcement Learning (DRL) systems. The study analyzes Stack Overflow posts related to DRL deployment on different platforms: server/cloud, mobile/embedded system, browser, and game engine. The authors identified 357 relevant posts and built a taxonomy of 31 unique challenges across 11 categories. The results show that RL environment-related challenges are the most popular, while communication-related challenges are the most difficult. The authors also found that DRL deployment is more difficult than other DRL issues. The study provides insights for practitioners, researchers, and framework developers to improve DRL system deployment.

type.justification: The paper presents an empirical study based on analyzing Stack Overflow posts, which makes it an empirical research paper.
type.quote: In this paper, we propose an empirical study on Stack Overflow (SO), the most popular Q&A forum for developers, to uncover and understand the challenges practitioners faced when deploying DRL systems.

name.justification: The main subject of the study is Deep Reinforcement Learning (DRL), making it the primary research field.
name.quote: Deploying Deep Reinforcement Learning Systems: A Taxonomy of Challenges

name.justification: The paper mentions Stable Baselines as a framework used to build DRL solutions.
name.quote: Frameworks and libraries like Stable Baselines [8], Keras-RL [9], and TensorForce [10] are continually being released to relieve the cost of building DRL solutions from scratch.

referenced_paper_title.justification: The reference for Stable Baselines is provided in the paper.
